newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Pertamina says signs oil agreement with Burma.
newsitem.headline: Pertamina says signs oil agreement with Burma.

text.p: Indonesia's state oil company Pertamina said on Saturday it had signed a memoranda of understanding to cooperate in upstream and downstream oil sectors in Burma.

"Pertamina has signed a memoranda of understanding with Burma to cooperate in its oil sectors. Pertamina will help Burma find oil reserves and also upgrade Burma's oil refineries," a Pertamina official told Reuters.
The official, who declined to be named, said Pertamina would increase Burma's refinery capacity but he did not elaborate.
"This is part of Pertamina's strategy to invest abroad both to find crude oil and also in oil products," he said.
Burma and OPEC member Indonesia are among the longest-running oil producers in Asia.
